SpaCE.Rmd

SpaCE (Spatial Cellular Estimator)

SpaCE is able to decompose cell identities and estimate cell-cell interactions in tumor spatial transcriptomics data sets.

SpaCE first estimates cancer cell abundance by integrating a gene pattern dictionary of copy number alterations and expression changes in common malignancies. SpaCE then uses a constrained regression model to calibrate local tissue densities and determine stromal and immune cell lineage hierarchies. Further, SpaCE can reveal potential cell-cell interactions in the tumor microenvironment.

Installation

To install SpaCE, we recommend using devtools:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("data2intelligence/SpaCE@HEAD")

Dependencies

R version >= 4.1.0. R packages: Matrix, jsonlite, png, ggplot2, reshape2, Rjags, psych, ppcor, tidygraph, parallel.

Example 

library(SpaCE)
SpaCE_obj <- create.SpaCE.object(platform="Visium",stPath = "./inst/extdata/Visium_BC")
SpaCE_obj <- SpaCE.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cancerType="BRCA", coreNo=8)
